channel.title: Webclient
channel.description:
I haven't actually tried to make a webclient before, so I'm not quite sure whats happening here. I downloaded a 317 deob, from moparisthebest.org. One of the original ones. I disabled RSA, and disabled the check to see if it's on a jagex domain. The client runs fine when run with a batch file, after it has been put into jar form and signed, but it won't run when it's in the web page. The first time it says connection error, and when it finished counting down and tried again it says logic error and the update server (The one Graham released) prints this: [CODE]SEVERE: Exception occured, closing channel... java.io.IOException: An existing connection was forcibly closed by the remote host at sun.nio.ch.SocketDispatcher.read0(Native Method) at sun.nio.ch.SocketDispatcher.read(SocketDispatcher.java:25) at sun.nio.ch.IOUtil.readIntoNativeBuffer(IOUtil.java:202) at sun.nio.ch.IOUtil.read(IOUtil.java:169) at sun.nio.ch.SocketChannelImpl.read(SocketChannelImpl.java:243) at org.jboss.netty.channel.socket.nio.NioWorker.read(NioWorker.java:313) at org.jboss.netty.channel.socket.nio.NioWorker.processSelectedKeys(NioWorker.java:272) at org.jboss.netty.channel.socket.nio.NioWorker.run(NioWorker.java:192) at org.jboss.netty.util.internal.IoWorkerRunnable.run(IoWorkerRunnable.java:46) at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.runTask(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:886) at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:908) at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:662)[/CODE]
I'm not sure what would cause it to work correctly when its not on the webpage, and not work when it is. Heres the html file I'm using:
[CODE]<html> <center> <applet archive=7th_Dimension.jar code=client.class width=765 height = 503> <param name="nodeid" value="1"/> <param name="portoff" value="0"/> <param name="lowmem" value="highmem"/> <param name="free" value="0"/> </applet> </center> </html>[/CODE]
I'd appreciate any help..

item.title: Webclient
item.dc:creator: @ladesman ladesman
item.description:
@ladesman wrote:

ill make it for you if its pi but ill do for $5 im trying to get a vps

item.title: Webclient
item.dc:creator: @Java11 Java`
item.description:
@Java11 wrote:

I haven’t actually tried to make a webclient before, so I’m not quite sure whats happening here. I downloaded a 317 deob, from moparisthebest.org. One of the original ones. I disabled RSA, and disabled the check to see if it’s on a jagex domain. The client runs fine when run with a batch file, after it has been put into jar form and signed, but it won’t run when it’s in the web page. The first time it says connection error, and when it finished counting down and tried again it says logic error and the update server (The one Graham released) prints this:

SEVERE: Exception occured, closing channel... java.io.IOException: An existing connection was forcibly closed by the remote host at sun.nio.ch.SocketDispatcher.read0(Native Method) at sun.nio.ch.SocketDispatcher.read(SocketDispatcher.java:25) at sun.nio.ch.IOUtil.readIntoNativeBuffer(IOUtil.java:202) at sun.nio.ch.IOUtil.read(IOUtil.java:169) at sun.nio.ch.SocketChannelImpl.read(SocketChannelImpl.java:243) at org.jboss.netty.channel.socket.nio.NioWorker.read(NioWorker.java:313) at org.jboss.netty.channel.socket.nio.NioWorker.processSelectedKeys(NioWorker.java:272) at org.jboss.netty.channel.socket.nio.NioWorker.run(NioWorker.java:192) at org.jboss.netty.util.internal.IoWorkerRunnable.run(IoWorkerRunnable.java:46) at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.runTask(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:886) at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:908) at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:662)

I’m not sure what would cause it to work correctly when its not on the webpage, and not work when it is. Heres the html file I’m using:

[CODE]







[/CODE]

I’d appreciate any help…

Read full topic
